I write this guide with very itchy skin across my collarbone. Itchiness is such a strange thing, not quite pain, not quite pressure. You can itch for all sorts of reasons. A hair on your skin, a scratch or a bite from a beastie, or worse. 
Athena compulsively over-grooms her stomach, paws, and neck. They itch for her. On her paws you can see contact dermatitist, but her skin is free of mites and bugs. So for about a year now I've been collecting data. 

```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(wesanderson)
short <- readxl::read_excel("data/Allergies.xlsx", 
                            sheet = "Abbrev Data")


ggplot(short) +
  geom_point(aes(x = Date, y = `Stomach Itching`, colour = factor(Antihistamine), 
                 shape = factor(`Hypoallergenic diet`) )) +
  theme_classic() 

ggplot(short) +
  geom_point(aes(x = Date, y = `Paw Itching`, colour = factor(Antihistamine), 
                 shape = factor(`Hypoallergenic diet`) )) +
  theme_classic() 


ggplot(short) +
  geom_boxplot(aes(x = as.factor(Antihistamine), y = `Stomach Itching`))


ggplot(short) +
  geom_boxplot(aes(x = `Hypoallergenic diet`, y = `Stomach Itching`)) +
  theme_classic()

ggplot(short) +
  geom_boxplot(aes(x = Antihistamine, y = `Stomach Itching`)) +
  theme_classic()

ggplot(short) +
  geom_boxplot(aes(x = Antihistamine, y = `Paw Itching`)) +
  theme_classic()

ggplot(short) +
  geom_boxplot(aes(x = `Hypoallergenic diet`, y = `Paw Itching`)) +
  theme_classic()

shortgather <- short %>%
  gather (key = BodyPart, value = Itchiness,
          `Stomach Itching`, `Paw Itching`)


ggplot (shortgather, aes(x=Antihistamine, y = Itchiness)) +
  geom_boxplot(fill = "gray66", colour = "slateblue4") +
  geom_jitter(colour = "lightslateblue")+
  facet_wrap(~BodyPart) +
  theme_classic()

ggplot (shortgather) +
  geom_boxplot(aes(x=`Hypoallergenic diet`, y = Itchiness)) +
  facet_wrap(~BodyPart) +
  theme_classic()


```
